Piala Dunia U-20: Khofifah Siap Bahas Stadion GBT dengan Risma
04 Nov 2019, 10:05 by Antara, Hari Prasetyo
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Gubernur Jawa Timur, Khofifah Indar Parawansa, mengatakan iap duduk bersama Wali Kota Surabaya Tri Rismaharini untuk membahas polemik Stadion Gelora Bung Tomo (GBT), demi kesuksesan sebagai tuan rumah Piala Dunia U-20 tahun 2021.
"Sebenarnya bukan persoalan siap atau tidak siap, tapi saya ini terbuka dengan siapa saja. Tadi saya juga mendengarkan masukan dari guru-guru," ujar Gubernur Khofifah yang ditemui di Kantor Gubernur Jatim di Jalan Pahlawan Surabaya, Senin, 4 November 2019.
Orang nomor satu di Jatim itu juga menegaskan, sebagai orang yang lahir dan besar di Kota Surabaya, ia akan selalu bersikap terbuka terhadap siapa saja. "Namanya wong Suroboyo iku terbuka. Anytime anywhere," ucap gubernur perempuan pertama di Jawa Timur tersebut.
Stadion Gelora Bung Tomo menjadi pembicaraan setelah menjadi salah satu calon arena Piala Dunia U-20 dua tahun mendatang, terlebih persoalan aroma sampah di sekitar stadion yang kini menjadi opini publik.
Sebelumnya, Gubernur Khofifah mengkhawatirkan bau sampah di TPA Benowo yang masuk ke Stadion GBT Surabaya saat perwakilan FIFA melakukan peninjauan ke lokasi salah satu arena Piala Dunia U-20 tahun 2021 di Indonesia.
Menteri Pemuda dan Olahraga (Menpora) RI, Zainuddin Amali, juga angkat bicara, bahkan meminta masing-masing pihak menghilangkan ego demi kemajuan olahraga Tanah Air.
Menpora mengatakan agar niat menjadi tuan rumah berjalan sukses, maka sejumlah pihak, termasuk Gubernur Jatim Khofifah Indar Parawansa dan Wali Kota Surabaya Tri Rismaharini harus duduk bersama tanpa mencari siapa yang salah sehingga ada jalan keluar.
"Yang penting adalah bagaimana persyaratan sesuai penetapan FIFA dapat terpenuhi. Mengelola olahraga tidak bisa dilakukan sendiri-sendiri dan harus bergotong-royong. Kuncinya harus bisa menurunkan ego masing-masing dan duduk bareng," kata dia.
Selain Stadion Gelora Bung Tomo di Surabaya, sembilan stadion lain sudah diajukan PSSI ke FIFA sebagai calon arena untuk Piala Dunia U-20 pada 2021.

U-20 World Cup: Khofifah Ready to Discuss the GBT Stadium with Risma
04 Nov 2019, 10:05 by Antara, Prasetyo Day
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The Governor of East Java, Khofifah Indar Parawansa, said he was sitting with Surabaya Mayor Tri Rismaharini to discuss the polemic of the Bung Tomo Gelora Stadium (GBT), for the success of hosting the 2021 U-20 World Cup.
"Actually it is not a matter of being ready or not ready, but I am open with anyone. Earlier I also listened to the input from teachers," said Governor Khofifah who was met at the East Java Governor's Office on Jalan Pahlawan Surabaya, Monday, November 4, 2019.
The number one person in East Java also asserted, as a person who was born and raised in the city of Surabaya, he would always be open to anyone. "Her name is wong Suroboyo iku is open. Anytime anywhere," said the first female governor in East Java.
Gelora Bung Tomo Stadium became the discussion after becoming one of the candidates for the U-20 World Cup arena the next two years, especially the issue of the smell of garbage around the stadium which is now a public opinion.
Previously, Governor Khofifah was worried about the smell of garbage at the Benowo landfill that entered the Surabaya GBT Stadium when FIFA representatives conducted a visit to the location of one of the 2021 U-20 World Cup arenas in Indonesia.
The Indonesian Minister of Youth and Sports (Menpora), Zainuddin Amali, also spoke up, even asking each party to remove the ego for the progress of the country's sport.
Menpora said that in order to be a successful host, a number of parties, including East Java Governor Khofifah Indar Parawansa and Surabaya Mayor Tri Rismaharini had to sit together without looking for who was wrong so there was a way out.
"The important thing is how the requirements in accordance with FIFA's determination can be fulfilled. Managing the sport cannot be done individually and must work together. The key must be to lower each other's egos and sit together," he said.
In addition to the Bung Tomo Gelora Stadium in Surabaya, nine other stadiums have been submitted by PSSI to FIFA as the arena candidates for the U-20 World Cup in 2021.
